Virtual Learner re-takes will be on Monday, Nov. 9, from noon to 6 p.m. in the hallway between the Cafeteria and the Arena.

Free lunch/breakfast available to all Penn students,"https://penn.phmschools.org/main-news/free-lunchbreakfast-available-all-penn-students","

Thanks to a USDA waiver, all meals served to students at P-H-M will be
Student accounts will be charged for any ala-carte sales.
Penn High School will offer pre-packaged breakfasts. Students will select pre-packaged meal components in the cafeteria.

column2: will also be offering take-home meals for students.&nbsp
column3: The meals will cover the days when students are learning from home.&nbsp
column4: Meals will be given out at the end of the day on Wednesday and Friday at Door L, Door C and the IMC.&nbsp
column5: The package will contain three breakfast and three lunch meals. Items will be frozen if possible and bags will have heating and storage instructions.

column1: We will have meals available for the 100 percent virtual learners from all schools and the community. Meals will be distributed at Penn High School Door C from 4-6 p.m. on Wednesday and Friday. It will be the same type of bag with only four meals on Wednesday and six on Friday. Students do not need to be present for the parent or guardian to pick up meals. Student ID&rsquo
Parents who do not want their student to have a free meal may donate the money to our fund for students who do not have money for meals.
column2: We are able to do the free meals due to a temporary waiver from the USDA. This will most likely last no longer than this semester. Money currently on student accounts will remain for their later use.

Penn to host SAT on Saturday, Oct. 3,"https://penn.phmschools.org/main-news/penn-host-sat-saturday-oct-3","

Penn High School is hosting the SAT on Saturday, October 3.
Students who are registered should report to Door A between 7:30-7:45 am.
Students must have a valid picture ID, your registration ticket, 2-3 sharpened #2 pencils, an approved calculator if applicable, and may bring a snack.
Students are subject to the following guidelines:

• You do not have Covid-19 or reason to believe you have Covid-19. Symptoms of Covid-19 include cough, fever, chills, muscle pain, shortness of breath or difficulty breathing, sore throat, new loss of taste or smell.
• In the past 14 days, you have not come into close contact - within 6 feet - with someone who has a positive covid-19 test or is presumed to have covid-19.
• To your knowledge, you are not violating any travel restrictions or quarantining requirements.
<li>You agree to wear a mask the entire time you&#39
column2: re at this test site and follow instructions from testing staff.
re accepting the risk of Covid-19 exposure. While we have taken measures to help create a safe environment, unfortunately it isn&#39
column3: t possible to remove all risk.

Eleven Penn students named National Merit Scholarship Semifinalists,"https://penn.phmschools.org/main-news/eleven-penn-students-named-national-merit-scholarship-semifinalists","

Penn High School Principal Sean Galiher announced that 11 Penn students have been named National Merit Scholarship Semifinalists.

Jayden Bell, Sydney Domal, Reagan Hoke, Anna Huber, Maya Kvaratskhelia, Evan Li, Ryan Ludwig, Joseph Radde, Aidan Sweeney, Benjamin VanderVeen and Grace Waddell are among 16,000 high school students nationwide who have the opportunity to compete for some 7,600 National Merit Scholarships worth more than $31 million.

column2: We are extremely proud of these students and their accomplishments,&rdquo
column4: This recognition is a culmination of the great efforts of these students, including all the wonderful teachers they have had while attending P-H-M schools.&nbsp
column5: These students represent our vision of excellence and have bright futures.&quot

column1: More than 1.5 million juniors in 21,000 high schools entered the 2020 National Merit Scholarship Program by taking the Preliminary SAT/National Merit Scholarship Qualifying Test. The 16,000 semifinalists represent less than one percent of the United States&rsquo
Merit Scholars are selected on the basis of their skills, accomplishments and potential for success in rigorous college studies.

Academics
